description: Understand oneself as a social being and the relationship with family, community, and society.
Mechanics is the branch of physics that deals with the study of motion, introducing scientific methods, measurements, significant figures, and units.
This section covers heat, temperature, and heat transfer, explaining them through kinetic theory at a microscopic level.
This section deals with wave processes, sound phenomena, and the electromagnetic spectrum, fundamental to understanding optics.
Explores electrical, magnetic, and electromagnetic principles and phenomena, introducing the importance of electronics in modern society.
Studies the structure of the atom and the interactions of subatomic particles, including nuclear energy and its impact on society and the environment.
Covers the chemical structure of water, carbohydrates, lipids, proteins, and their roles in living organisms. Also includes cell structure and functions.
Discusses nucleic acids, protein synthesis, cell division, genetic engineering, and natural selection.
Focuses on sexual and asexual reproduction in plants, and sexual reproduction in humans, including reproductive systems and gametogenesis.
Details the processes of photosynthesis, cellular respiration, energy flow, and nutrient cycling in ecosystems.
Covers plant and mammalian transport systems, homeostasis, hormonal action, kidney functions, and nervous coordination.
Explores the practical applications of biology in areas such as biotechnology, medicine, agriculture, and environmental management.
This module introduces students to the role of geography in shaping the society and culture of the Caribbean Region and its diaspora, including historical evolution.
This module explores the interrelationships among social, cultural, political, and economic factors in the development of the Caribbean Region and its diaspora.

section_name: Module 3: Investigating Issues in the Caribbean
description: This module introduces students to concepts and skills for conducting research related to Caribbean regional and diasporic experiences.
Covers atomic structure, periodic table, bonding, and introductory chemical principles.
Explores reaction rates, chemical equilibria, and the principles applied in various systems.
Discusses the properties and reactions of different groups of elements and their practical applications.

section_name: Module 1: The Chemistry of Carbon Compounds
description: Discusses organic chemistry topics including structure, formulae, functional groups, isomerism, acidity, basicity, and macromolecules.

section_name: Module 2: Analytical Methods and Separation Techniques
description: Covers analytical chemistry methods such as titrimetry, chromatography, distillation, and the analysis of data including uncertainty and error.

Focuses on the application of chemical principles to industry and environmental issues, including Green Chemistry, pollution control, and the environmental impact of industries like aluminum, ammonia, and petroleum production.
Section I requires candidates to listen to a sentence and choose the best corresponding picture.
Section I involves completing sentences with the most appropriate response from multiple options.
Oral examination including responding to situations, reading aloud, and guided conversation.
Writing a letter based on provided cues in the target language.
Introduction to the principles and purposes of accounting, including careers and ethical issues.
Understanding the accounting process, cycle, and financial statements.
Recording transactions using books of original entry, including cash and credit transactions.
Managing ledgers and preparing the trial balance.

section_name: Preparation and Analysis of Financial Statements
description: Preparing and analyzing financial statements of sole traders.
Making necessary adjustments to financial statements, including depreciation and bad debts.
Implementing control systems like suspense accounts and bank reconciliation statements.
Understanding partnership accounting, including profit-sharing and capital accounts.
Managing accounts for limited liability companies, co-operatives, and non-profits.
Managing manufacturing accounts and inventory control.
Applying accounting knowledge in entrepreneurial settings, including payroll and budgeting.
Covers atomic structure, periodic table, bonding, and introductory chemical principles.
Explores reaction rates, chemical equilibria, and the principles applied in various systems.
Discusses the properties and reactions of different groups of elements and their practical applications.
Drawing, Painting and Mixed-media, Graphics and Visual Communication, Printmaking, Textile Design and Manipulation
Documentation of the theory, process, and practice of visual arts
Collection of six pieces (three from each expressive form selected)

section_name: Grammar and Mechanics - Word Choice and Meaning
description: Focuses on explaining the meaning conveyed in listening and reading through word choice, grammar, punctuation, and paragraphing. Introduces students to various forms of word choice, including formal and informal, standard and non-standard, Creole, literal and figurative use, synonyms, and antonyms.

section_name: Grammar and Mechanics - Syntax and Sentence Structure
description: Teaches students to identify and explain the ordering and connection of words to form sentences with particular meanings. Covers aspects of syntax such as sentence types, functions, and patterns to enhance clarity and effectiveness in both spoken and written communication.

section_name: Grammar and Mechanics - Morphology and Word Formation
description: Examines morphology, the study of word forms and their effects on meaning. Encourages students to analyze components like prefixes, suffixes, tense, and number, and to apply these rules in constructing sentences that communicate precise meaning.

section_name: Grammar and Mechanics - Punctuation and its Effects on Meaning
description: Focuses on recognizing punctuation marks and their roles in conveying meaning. Students learn the functions of various punctuation marks, including commas, colons, apostrophes, and ellipses, and practice applying them correctly to enhance comprehension and written expression.

section_name: Grammar and Mechanics - Paragraphing and Structure
description: Teaches students to recognize the function of paragraphs in structuring material for clarity and emphasis. Focuses on identifying topic sentences, creating outlines, and evaluating the flow of ideas to ensure logical progression and effective communication.

Teaches students to identify, understand, and analyze key elements in informative texts, such as main ideas, supporting details, and organizational patterns, to enhance comprehension of factual information.
Focuses on the structure and purpose of informative discourse, helping students recognize how organizational techniques convey information effectively and suit the author’s purpose.

section_name: Informative Discourse - Language and Tone in Informative Writing
description: Emphasizes understanding the impact of language, tone, and style in informative texts, allowing students to identify formal, neutral, or informal tones based on audience and purpose.

section_name: Informative Discourse - Evaluating Credibility and Reliability
description: Focuses on developing critical skills to assess the credibility and reliability of information sources, enhancing students’ discernment in evaluating the validity of informational content.
Teaches students to effectively summarize and paraphrase information, focusing on extracting main ideas and rephrasing content accurately without altering the intended meaning.

Introduces students to key literary elements such as plot, theme, character, and setting. Develops skills to identify and interpret these elements across genres to enhance understanding of literary works.

section_name: Literary Discourse - Identifying and Interpreting Figurative Language
description: Focuses on recognizing and interpreting figurative language, including similes, metaphors, personification, and symbolism, to deepen comprehension of literary texts and enhance literary appreciation.

section_name: Literary Discourse - Exploring Tone, Mood, and Style
description: Teaches students to recognize tone, mood, and style in literary texts, enhancing their ability to discern the author's attitude and the emotional effect of the text on the reader.

section_name: Literary Discourse - Theme and Moral Interpretation
description: Focuses on identifying and interpreting themes and moral lessons in literature, teaching students to relate them to personal experiences and societal issues.

section_name: Literary Discourse - Comparative Analysis Across Texts
description: Encourages students to compare themes, styles, and literary techniques across different texts and genres, fostering critical analysis and a deeper understanding of literary diversity.

section_name: Argumentative Discourse - Structuring and Editing for Coherence
description: Teaches students to structure their argumentative essays for logical flow and coherence, with emphasis on editing techniques to ensure clarity, consistency, and adherence to argumentative conventions.

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Powers, Roots, and Scientific Notation
description:
<p>Delve into calculations involving exponents, roots, and scientific notation to handle large and small numbers effectively.</p>
<p><span>Students will compute powers of real numbers of the form </span><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>a</mi></msup></mrow></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord"><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="msupsub"><span class="vlist-t"><span class="vlist-r"><span class="vlist"><span><span class="pstrut"></span><span class="sizing reset-size6 size3 mtight"><span class="mord mathnormal mtight">a</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span><span> where </span><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>&#8712;</mo><mi mathvariant="double-struck">Q</mi></mrow></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">a</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">∈</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathbb">Q</span></span></span></span><span>,</span></p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Operations Mastery and Properties
description: <p>Delve into calculations involving exponents, roots, and scientific notation to handle large and small numbers effectively.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Fractions, Decimals, Percents, Ratios, and Proportions
description: <p>Delve into calculations involving exponents, roots, and scientific notation to handle large and small numbers effectively.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Factors, Multiples, and Common Divisors
description: <p>Master conversions and comparisons between fractions, decimals, percents, and apply ratios and proportions in problem-solving.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Place Value, Base Systems, and Precision
description: <p>Build a strong foundation in number theory concepts like factors, multiples, HCF, and LCM for simplifying expressions and solving equations.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Unit Conversions and Measurements
description: <p>Understand place value in various number bases and express values to specified precision for accurate numerical representation.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Sequences and Patterns
description: <p>Develop competency in converting units across systems, including metric conversions and time formats, essential for scientific calculations.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Ratios, Proportions, and Problem Solving
description: <p>Identify patterns in sequences and derive rules, supporting logical reasoning and mathematical modeling in diverse applications.</p>

section_name: Number Theory and Computation: Comprehensive Problem Solving
description: <p>Apply knowledge of ratios and proportions to solve practical problems, a key skill in science, engineering, and daily life.</p>

section_name: Consumer Arithmetic: Discounts, Profits, and Losses
description: <p>Integrate all learned concepts to tackle complex problems, enhancing critical thinking and analytical skills.</p>

section_name: Consumer Arithmetic: Installment Payments and Mortgages
description: <p>Master calculations of discounts, sales tax, profit, and loss to make informed decisions in business and personal finance.</p>

section_name: Consumer Arithmetic: Interest Calculations and Depreciation
description: <p>Delve into calculations involving exponents, roots, and scientific notation to handle large and small numbers effectively.</p>

section_name: Consumer Arithmetic: Currency Conversion and Financial Measures
description: <p>Learn to calculate simple and compound interest, appreciation, and depreciation to evaluate investments and asset values over time.</p>

section_name: Consumer Arithmetic: Managing Expenses and Investments
description: <p>Develop skills in currency conversion and solving financial problems involving various measures, essential for global commerce and personal finance.</p>

<p>Delve into calculations involving exponents, roots, and scientific notation to handle large and small numbers effectively.</p>
<p><span>Covers essential concepts such as examples and non-examples of sets, set membership, cardinality, finite and infinite sets, universal set, empty set, and complements. Different representations are included, such as descriptions, set-builder notation </span><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">{</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>:</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>&#60;</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>&#60;</mo><mn>4</mn><mo separator="true">,</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>&#8712;</mo><mi mathvariant="double-struck">N</mi><mo stretchy="false">}</mo></mrow></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">A</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mopen">{</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">:</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord">0</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">&lt;</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">&lt;</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord">4</span><span class="mpunct">,</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">∈</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathbb">N</span><span class="mclose">}</span></span></span></span><span>, and listing elements.</span></p>
<p>Understand the basics of set theory, including set language, notation, and types of sets, to establish a foundation for logical reasoning in mathematics.</p>

section_name: Sets: Venn Diagrams and Problem Solving
description: <p>Develop skills in identifying relationships among sets using set notation, symbols, and operations, crucial for analyzing mathematical and real-world problems.</p>

section_name: Measurement: Units, Conversions, and Basic Calculations
description: <p>Apply Venn diagrams to visually represent and solve set problems, enhancing comprehension of relationships and facilitating problem-solving.</p>

section_name: Measurement: Area, Surface Area, and Volume of Shapes
description:
<p>Understand and apply appropriate units for various measurements, including length, mass, area, volume, capacity, temperature, and time, for accurate calculations.</p>
<p><span>Includes calculating areas of polygons, circles, sectors, and triangles (given two sides and the included angle), as well as surface area and volume of 3D shapes. Key formulas include the surface area of a sphere </span><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math section_name: Measurement: Advanced Applications and Problem Solving
description: <p>Learn to calculate areas, surface areas, and volumes of geometric shapes, including complex shapes, for practical applications in science and engineering.</p>
<p>Apply measurement concepts in real-world problem-solving, including speed, distance, time relationships, and margin of error estimation.</p>

section_name: Statistics: Data Representation and Central Tendency
description: Learn to represent data visually and calculate measures of central tendency, essential for summarizing and interpreting datasets effectively.
<p>Analyze the spread of data using measures of dispersion, including range and interquartile range, and interpret trends through cumulative frequency (Ogive) curves.</p>
<p><span>Analyze the spread of data using measures of dispersion, including range and interquartile range, and interpret trends through cumulative frequency (Ogive) curves.</span></p>

section_name: Algebra: Equations, Inequalities, and Formula Manipulation
Relations and Functions: Concepts and Notations
description:
<p>Apply probability concepts and make inferences from statistical data, essential for interpreting real-world situations and conducting simple experiments.</p>
<p><span>Other aspects include:</span><br /><span>- </span><strong>Characteristics of a Function</strong><span>: Identify functions using the vertical line test.</span><br /><span>- section_name: Geometry and Trigonometry: Fundamentals and Constructions
description: <p>Explore quadratic and non-linear functions, their graphs, and applications, enhancing understanding of complex relationships and problem-solving in mathematical contexts.</p>

section_name: Geometry and Trigonometry: Geometric Properties and Theorems
description: <p>Understand basic geometric concepts and accurately construct geometric figures using appropriate instruments.</p>

section_name: Geometry and Trigonometry: Transformations and Symmetry

section_name: Geometry and Trigonometry: Advanced Trigonometry and Bearings

description: <p>Understand basic vector concepts and perform vector operations to solve geometric and physical problems involving displacement, direction, and magnitude.</p>

section_name: Applications of Vectors and Matrices in Transformations
description:
<p>Gain an understanding of matrices and perform basic matrix operations, including addition, subtraction, and scalar multiplication, for practical problem-solving.</p>
<p><span>- </span><strong>Determinants and Inverses</strong><span>: Evaluate determinants of 2x2 matrices and find the inverse of non-singular 2x2 matrices using the adjoint method.</span><br /><span>- </span><strong>Transformation Matrices</strong><span>: Represent transformations, including reflections over the x-axis, y-axis, lines </span><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">y</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span><span> and </span><span class="katex"><span class="katex-mathml"><math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>&#8722;</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></semantics></math></span><span class="katex-html" aria-hidden="true"><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord mathnormal">y</span><span class="mspace"></span><span class="mrel">=</span><span class="mspace"></span></span><span class="base"><span class="strut"></span><span class="mord">−</span><span class="mord mathnormal">x</span></span></span></span><span>, rotations about the origin, and enlargements with a center at the origin using 2x2 matrices.</span><br /><span>- </span><strong>Applications</strong><span>: Solving linear simultaneous equations in two variables with matrices and using matrices in problems related to Arithmetic, Algebra, and Geometry</span></p>
